sense.gloss: to keep (e.g. the lead), to maintain (a standard, situation, etc.)
to put aside (for someone), to save (e.g. a seat)
to keep (the ball; in soccer, rugby, etc.), to retain possession
person one is dating while hoping for someone better

sdata.j: この↑店↑↓みせ↓は、ボトルを|キープ|できるんですか。
sdata.e: Can I reserve a bottle and have you keep it here for me?

sdata.j: ↑ＯＥＣＤ↑↓おーいーしーでぃー↓の↑調査↑↓ちょうさ↓で↑北欧↑↓ほくおう↓↑諸国↑↓しょこく↓が↑税率↑↓ぜいりつ↓において↑世界↑↓せかい↓の↑上位↑↓じょうい↓を|キープ|した。
sdata.e: In the OECD survey, northern European countries are keeping their high ranking in tax-rates.

sdata.j: デザートが↑入↑↓はい↓るスペースを|キープ|しておくつもりだ。
sdata.e: I plan to leave a place for the dessert.
